General Notes

All API methods, if not specified otherwise explicitly, are served with api.qencode.com host.
Although the API methods described below accept POST params as application/x-www-form-urlencoded and return JSON.
In case of FAILURE during method call response contains 'error' param set to value greater 0 (error code). In case of SUCCESS, the response contains 'error' param set to 0.

Error Codes

Below is an Error Codes table for the Qencode API.

ERROR CODE VALUE DESCRIPTION
ERROR_OK 0 Operation completed successfully
ERROR_SERVER_INTERNAL 1 Internal server error occurred. Please contact support in this case.
ERROR_BAD_API_KEY 2 Your API key does not pass validation.
ERROR_API_KEY_NOT_FOUND 3 We can't find such API key in our database.
ERROR_BAD_TOKEN 4 Token does not pass validation.
ERROR_TOKEN_NOT_FOUND 5 We can't find such token in our database
ERROR_SERVICE_SUSPENDED 6 Service suspended. There can be different reasons for that, e.g. you are using Free plan and 500 minutes limit is reached, or you have an outstanding invoice not paid. In case you are not sure what's the reason please contact support.
ERROR_MASTER_NOT_FOUND 7 Server issue. Please contact support in this case.
ERROR_SYSTEM_BUSY 8 We don't have enough resources to process request at the moment. You should retry it in a number of seconds specified in response.
ERROR_BAD_PAYLOAD 9 Payload value is too long.
ERROR_PROJECT_NOT_FOUND 10 Server issue. Please contact support in this case.
ERROR_BAD_PROFILE 11 Profile field value does not pass validation.
ERROR_PROFILE_NOT_FOUND 12 We can't find specified profile in our database.
ERROR_BAD_TOKENS 13 Task_tokens field value does not pass validation.
ERROR_FIELD_REQUIRED 14 Value for field specified in response is required in request.

Getting Session Token

/v1/access_token

In order to access Qencode API you should acquire a session token. You will be passing it as a param to create_task method described below.

attributes

api_key

required

An API access key obtained once registered at qencode.com as a user.

To build secure solution we strongly recommend NOT to call this method directly from any client application of yours as you expose your api key to the world in this case. Recommended way is to obtain session token from your server and then pass to the client app.

Response example

{
  “token” : “1357924680”,
  “expire” : “2017-12-31 23:59:59”
}

Creating Transcoding Task

/v1/create_task

This method requests a file's uploading endpoint from the Qencode service.

attributes

token

required

Session's token returns with access_token method

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/create_task \
  -d token=76682314a86ed377730873394f8172f2

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Uploading Video File

https://master/v1/upload_file/task_token

This method uploads files using the tus protocol for renewable uploads. Use this method for direct uploading your videos to the Qencode servers (e.g. from your website or mobile application). Specify a direct URL using start_encode method as a param to the already uploaded files (e.g. Amazon S3 storage).

attributes

task_token

required

Task's token returns with create_task method

Please note that upload_file method should be called for a host and returned with the create_task method described above.

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/create_task \
  -d token=76682314a86ed377730873394f8172f2

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Starting Transcoding Process

/v1/start_encode

This route is responsible for starting transcoding for an already uploaded file.

attributes

task_token

required

Task token returned with create_task method.

uri | stitch

required

Either uri or stitch param should be specified.
The uri is responsible for defining a single video's URI, whether it's a video URL or ID returned with upload_file method.
Use the stitch param in order to combine several input videos into a single one. Stitch should be a json-list of URLs or video-objects. Specify start_time and duration while using an object form. Check the examples below.
["https://youserver.com/video1.mp4"
"https://youserver.com/video1.mp4",
"https://youserver.com/video2.mkv",
{"url":"https://yourserver.com/video3.mp4", "start_time":"100.0", "duration":"60.0"}]
The same video URL can be specified several times in a stitch array (e.g. to stitch different clips from the same video). In this case the original video will be downloaded only at once.

profiles

required

Comma-separated list of transcoding profile IDs.

transfer_method

optional

Transfer method ID

payload

optional

Any string with length of 1000 characters (max).
It might become handy if you need to pass your website's ID or any JSON object.

start_time

optional

Specifies the start time (in seconds) to begin video transcoding from.

duration

optional

Specifies video fragment's duration (in seconds) to be transcoded.

output_path_variables

optional

JSON-encoded string that contains a dictionary (key-value pairs) of params for video or image output path/directory.
This refers to the Output path values specified in the transcoding profile for video or image settings. It can contain placeholders defined in curly braces, e.g. {myfilename} or {video_id}, where the actual values for them will be populated from output_path_variables dictionary.
Check the examples below.
"Output path for video setting:"
output/mp4/{scene_id}/1080/video.mp4
"output_path_variables:"
{"scene_id":"12345"}
"Resulting video path:"
/output/mp4/12345/1080/video.mp4
Please note, that {uuid} and {index} values are generated by transcoding system though if specified in output_path_variables it will override the system's values.

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/start_encode \
  -d task_token=63adfb01d408081b10440682f3a64114 \
  -d uri="https://qa.qencode.com/static/test_mini.mp4" \
  -d start_time=10 \
  -d duration=20 \
  -d profiles=5a2a846a26e88,5a2a846a28604 \
  -d transfer_method=5aa2875489681 \
  -d payload="12345" \
  -d output_path_variables='{"category":"test_videos","video_name":"12345"}'

Response example

{"error":0,"status_url":"https:\/\/api.qencode.com\/v1\/status"}

Starting Transcoding Process with Custom Params

/v1/start_encode2

This method runs transcoding of an uploaded file applying custom settings to it. Use this method in case you need a refined control over the transcoding process.
Check Description of query object properties

attributes

task_token

required

Task token returned with create_task method.

query

required

JSON object containing the details of transcoding procedure. See examples and description of query's properties below.

profiles

optional

Any string with length of 1000 characters (max).
It might become handy if you need to pass your website's ID or any JSON object.

Query's properties description:


source | stitch

required

Either source or stitch param should be specified.
The source is responsible for defining a single video's URI, whether it's an http(s) URL or tus URI returned with upload_file method.
Use the stitch param in order to combine several input videos into a single one. Stitch should be a json-list of URLs or video-objects. Specify start_time and duration while using an object form. Check the examples below.
["https://youserver.com/video1.mp4"
"https://youserver.com/video1.mp4",
"https://youserver.com/video2.mkv",
{"url":"https://yourserver.com/video3.mp4", "start_time":"100.0", "duration":"60.0"}]
The same video URL can be specified several times in a stitch array (e.g. to stitch different clips from the same video). In this case the original video will be downloaded only at once.

format

required

A list of objects, each describing params for a single output video stream (MP4, WEBM, HLS or MPEG-DASH).

output

optional

Output video format. Currently supported values are mp4, webm, advanced_hls, advanced_dash.
The thumbnail & thumbnails values are used for creation of thumbnail images. See the Create thumbnails section for more details.

destination

required

URI to store output video in. In case this value is not specified, video will be temporarily stored on the Qencode's servers.
For Amazon S3 use the following URL format:
s3://access_id:access_secret@s3.amazonaws.com
[:port]/bucket_name/path
For custom S3 server just specify your hostname:
s3://access_id:access_secret@example.com
[:port]/bucket_name/path
For Aspera:
fasp://access_id:access_secret@example.com[:tcp_port][:udp_port]/path
For FTP:
ftp://access_id:access_secret@example.com[:port]/path

It is highly recommended to you specify destination as a JSON object with the following structure:

S3
{
"url":“s3://example.com/bucket/video.mp4”,
"key":"your_access_key",
"secret":"your_access_secret",
"permissions":"public-read", //optional field [*]
"storage_class":"REDUCED_REDUNDANCY"//optional field [**]
}

FTP
{
"url":“ftp://example.com:[port]/folder/video.mp4”,
"key":"user",
"secret":"password",
"is_passive":"true/false",
"use_tls":"true/false"
}

Aspera
{
"url":“fasp://example.com/folder/video.mp4”,
"key":"user",
"secret":"password",
"tcp_port":"port",
"udp_port":"port"
}

Please make sure a video file name (for MP4/WEBM) or a folder (for HLS/MPEG-DASH) is included in path. Check the Bucket/Object Permissions & Reduced Redundancy Storage for more information.

file_extension

required

Output video file extension (only for MP4 format, defaults to '.mp4').

size

required

Output video frame size in pixels ("width"x"height"). Defaults to original frame size.

rotate

required

Rotate video through specified degrees value. Possible values are 90, 180, 270.

framerate

required

Output video frame rate. Defaults to original frame rate.

bitrate

required

Output video stream bitrate in kylobytes. Defaults is up to 512. Please note, don't specify bitrate unless you want constant bitrate for the video. To create variable bitrate use quality param.

quality

required

Output video stream quality (aka Constant rate factor). Use this param to produce optimized videos with variable bitrate. For H.264 the range is 0-51, where 0 is lossless and 51 is worst possible. A lower value is a higher quality and a subjectively sane range is 18-28. Consider 18 to be visually lossless. It should look the same or nearly the same as the input but it isn't technically lossless.

pix_format

required

Output video pixel format. Possible values are yuv420p, yuv422p, yuvj420p, yuvj422p. Defaults to yuv420p.

profile

required

x264 video codec settings profile. Possible values are high, main, baseline. Defaults to main.

video_codec

required

Output stream video codec. Defaults to libx264. Possible values are libx264, libx265, libvpx, libvpx-vp9.

video_codec_parameters

required

Output stream video codec parameters.

Video_Codec_Parameters Description:

vprofile

required

x264 video codec settings profile. Possible values are high, main, baseline. Main is default.

level

required

Set of constraints that indicate a degree of required decoder performance for a profile.

coder

required

Context-Adaptive Binary Arithmetic Coding (CABAC) is the default entropy encoder used by x264. Possible values are 1 and 0. Default is 1.

flags2

required

Allows B-frames to be kept as references. Possible values are +bpyramid, +wpred, +mixed_refs, +dct8×8, -fastpskip/+fastpskip, +aud Default is None.

partitions

required

One of x264's most useful features is the ability to choose among many combinations of inter and intra partitions. Possible values are +partp8x8, +partp4x4, +partb8x8, +parti8x8, +parti4x4. Default is None.

directpred

required

Defines motion detection type, 0 -- none, 1 -- spatial, 2 -- temporal, 3 -- auto. Default is 1.

me_method

required

Motion Estimation method used in encoding. Possible values are epzs, hex, umh, full. Default is None.

subq

required

Set sub pel motion estimation quality

trellis

required

Set rate-distortion optimal quantization

refs

required

Number of reference frames each P-frame can use. The range is from 0-16

cmp

required

Set full pel me compare function.

me_range

required

Set limit motion vectors range (1023 for DivX player)

sc_threshold

required

Set scene change threshold.

i_qfactor

required

Set QP factor between P and I frames

b_strategy

required

Set strategy to choose between I/P/B-frames.

qcomp

required

Set video quantizer scale compression (VBR). It is used as a constant in the ratecontrol equation. Recommended default range rc_eq is 0.0-1.0.

qmin

required

Set min video quantizer scale (VBR). Must be included between -1 and 69, default value is 2.

qmax

required

Set max video quantizer scale (VBR). Must be included between -1 and 1024, default value is 31.

qdiff

required

Set max difference between the quantizer scale (VBR).

max_rate

required

Set max bitrate tolerance (in bits/s). Requires bufsize to be set.

min_rate

required

Set min bitrate tolerance (in bits/s). CBR encode is recommended.

sws_flags

required

Set the scaler flags. This is also used to set the scaling algorithm. Only a single algorithm should be selected. Default value is ‘bicubic’.

preset

required

Specify the preset for matching stream(s).

flags

required

Set generic flags. (Possible values ‘mv4’, ‘qpel’, ‘loop’, ‘qscale’, ‘pass1’, ‘pass2’, ‘gray’, ‘emu_edge’, ‘psnr’, ‘truncated’, ‘ildct’, ‘low_delay’, ‘global_header’, ‘bitexact’, ‘aic’, ‘cbp’, ‘qprd’, ‘ilme’, ‘cgop’)

rc_lookahead

required

Set number of frames to look ahead for frametype and ratecontrol.

audio_codec

required

Output file audio codec name. Possible values are aac, vorbis. Defaults to aac.

audio_bitrate

required

Output file audio bitrate value in kylobytes. Defaults to 64.

audio_sample_rate

required

Output file audio sample rate. Defaults to 44100.

audio_channels_number

required

Output file audio channels number. Default value is 2.

segment_duration

required

Segment duration to split media (in seconds). Defaults to 8.

stream

required

Contains a list of elements each describing a single view stream for HLS or MPEG-DASH format.

keyframe

required

Keyframe period (in frames). Defaults to 90.

start_time

required

Specifies the start time (in seconds) in input video to begin transcoding from.

duration

required

Specifies duration of the video fragment (in seconds) to be transcoded.

two_pass

required

Use two-pass encoding to achieve the exact bitrate value for an output. Please note, that two-pass encoding is two times slower than the one-pass coding. The price to be twice higher.

Example of JSON object for query param

 {
  "query": {
      "source": "https://example.com/myvideo.mp4",
      "format": [
      {
          "output": "mp4",
          "destination": "",
          "file_extension": "mp4",
          "size": "320x240",
          "rotate": "90",
          "framerate": "25",
          "bitrate": "300",
          "pix_format": "yuv420p",
          "profile": "main",
          "video_codec_parameters": {
          "vprofile": "baseline",
          "level": "31",
          "coder": "0",
          "flags2": "-bpyramid+fastpskip-dct8x8",
          "partitions": "+parti8x8+parti4x4+partp8x8+partb8x8",
          "directpred": "2",
          "me_method": "hex"
          },
          "audio_bitrate": "64",
          "audio_sample_rate": "44100",
          "audio_channels_number": "2"
      },
      {
          "output": "advanced_hls",
          "destination": "",
          "segment_duration": "4",
          "stream": [
          {
              "size": "320x240",
              "rotate": "180",
              "framerate": "30",
              "bitrate": "300",
              "pix_format": "yuv420p",
              "profile": "main",
              "video_codec_parameters": {
              "vprofile": "baseline",
              "level": "31",
              "coder": "0",
              "flags2": "-bpyramid+fastpskip-dct8x8",
              "partitions": "+parti8x8+parti4x4+partp8x8+partb8x8",
              "directpred": "2",
              "me_method": "hex"
              },
              "audio_bitrate": "64",
              "audio_sample_rate": "44100",
              "audio_channels_number": "2"
          },
          {
              "size": "160x120",
              "bitrate": "150",
              "keyframe": "60",
              "profile": "main"
          }
          ]
      }
      ]
  }
}

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/start_encode2 \
   -d task_token=b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1 \
   -d payload="12345" \
   -d query='{"query": {
   "source": "https://qa.qencode.com/static/test_mini.mp4",
   "format": [
     {
       "output": "mp4",
       "destination": {
         "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/test_mini.mp4",
         "key":"abcde12345",
         "secret":"abcde12345",
         "permissions": "public-read"
       },
             "framerate": "29.97",
             "keyframe": "25",
             "file_extension": "mp4",
             "size": "360x240",
             "video_codec_parameters": {
               "vprofile": "baseline",
               "level": "31",
               "coder": "0",
               "flags2": "-bpyramid+fastpskip-dct8x8",
               "partitions": "+parti8x8+parti4x4+partp8x8+partb8x8",
               "directpred": "2",
               "me_method": "hex"
             },
             "start_time": "10",
             "duration": "20",
             "audio_bitrate": "64",
             "audio_sample_rate": "44100",
             "audio_channels_number": "2"
           }
         ]
       }
      }

Response example

{"error":0,"status_url":"https:\/\/api.qencode.com\/v1\/status"}

Getting Task Status

/v1/status or https://master/v1/status

This method returns status of one or more transcoding tasks. Response contains status and percent params indicating current task state and progress. Possible values of task status are listed below.

attributes

/v1/task_tokens

required

A list of task tokens

Please note that status method should be called for a master host returned with the start_encode or start_encode2 methods described above.
In case master host is down and you get timeouts run this method against api.qencode.com host.
Value Description
Downloading Video is being downloaded to Qencode server.
Queued Task is waiting for available encoders.
Encoding Video is being transcoded.
Saving Video is being saved to destination location (e.g. Amazon S3 bucket).
Completed Video was saved to destination location. Transcoding job has completed successfully.

Request example

{
  "output" : "thumbnails",
  "destination": {
    "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/thumb/bbb/",
    "key":"abcde12345",
    "secret":"abcde12345",
    "permissions": "public-read"
  },
  "interval": 30,
  "width" : 320,
  "height" : 240
}

Response example

{
      "error": 0, 
      "statuses": {
          "a2600fc63e4511e8ac870202b56d93e3": {
              "status": "completed", 
              "percent": 100, 
              "error": 0, 
              "error_description": null, 
              "images": [
                  {
                      "tag": "image-0-0", 
                      "profile": "5a5db6fa5b8ac", 
                      "user_tag": "320x240/5", 
                      "storage": {
                          "bucket": "qencode-test", 
                          "type": "amazon_s3", 
                          "key": "output/320x240/12345_0.png", 
                          "format": null
                      }, 
                      "url": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/qencode-test/output/320x240/12345_0.png"
                  }, 
                  {
                      "tag": "image-1-0", 
                      "profile": "5a5db6fa5b8ac", 
                      "user_tag": "320x240/15", 
                      "storage": {
                          "bucket": "qencode-test", 
                          "type": "amazon_s3", 
                          "key": "output/320x240/12345_1.png", 
                          "format": null
                      }, 
                      "url": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/qencode-test/output/320x240/12345_1.png"
                  }
              ], 
              "videos": [
                  {
                      "tag": "video-0-0", 
                      "profile": "5a5db6fa5b8ac", 
                      "user_tag": "480p", 
                      "storage": {
                          "bucket": "qencode-test", 
                          "type": "amazon_s3", 
                          "key": "Outbound/480/12345.mp4", 
                          "format": "mp4"
                      }, 
                      "url": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/qencode-test/output/480/12345.mp4", 
                      "bitrate": 1692, 
                      "meta": "{\"width\": 854, \"resolution\": 480, \"height\": 480}", 
                      "duration": "0.371511"
                  }
              ]
          }
      }
  }

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Task Callback

/v1/task_token

In order to handle events for newly created, completed or any other tasks status changes on your server you may specify callback urls in your qencode account settings. Check parameters that are listed below.

attributes

task_token

required

A task's token.

event

required

Name of the event, i.e. 'queued', 'saved' or 'error'

payload

required

Payload is passed by a client's application to start_encode or start_encode2 methods.

error_code

required

Error code (only for error event).

error_message

required

Error's description (for error events only).

Request example

{
  “task_token” : “1234567890”,
  “event” : “saved”,
  “payload” : “user data”
  "status" : {JSON-encoded string representing task status, see Getting task status}
}

Subtask Callback

/v1/task_token

Subtask is a procedure of converting a video into the specified resolution in your transcoding profile. Subtask callback allows you to handle the following status changes:

  • Converting - encoding process has already been started for a subtask.

  • Converted - encoding process was finished successfully for a subtask.

  • Saving - output video is being saved to the required directory.

  • Saved - output video was successfully saved to the required directory.

  • Error - an error occured during processing the subtask.

Check parameters that are listed below.

attributes

subtasks

required

A list of subtasks there are updates for.

task_token

required

A task's token.

event

required

List of events since last update

payload

required

Payload is passed by a client's application to start_encode or start_encode2 methods.

tag

required

Subtask's tag, specified in transcoding profile settings

error_code

required

Error code (only for error event).

error_message

required

Error's description (for error events only).

Request example

{
  “subtasks”: [
      {
          “token” : “1234567890”,
          “events” : [“converting”, “converted”],
          “payload” : “user data”,
          “tag” : “720“
      },
      {
          “token” : “1234569090”,
          “events” : [“saving”, “saved”],
          “payload” : “user data”,
          “tag” : “480“
      }
  ]
}

Adding logo/watermark

/v1/create_token

This route is used for adding logo or watermark to an output video. An object that describes logo/watermark should be inserted into the “format” element.

attributes

token

required

b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1

Request example

"format": [
 {
  "output": "mp4",
   ...
    "logo": {
      "source": "https://yourserver.com/watermark.png",
      "x": 10,
      "y": 10
    }
  }
]

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Stitching videos with /v1/start_encode

/v1/start_encode2

This route is for stitching videos using /v1/start_encode method. The key thing here is using the “stitch” parameter for /v1/start_encode method instead of a regular “uri” and a “source” query attribute for the /v1/start_encode2 method. The same JSON array is used for both methods. Specify URLs for input videos to "stitch" array elements.

attributes

token

required

b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1

URLs' Stitching Examples formatted as a regular JSON and as an object.

 [
  "https://yourserver.com/video1.mp4",
  "https://yourserver.com/video2.mp4",
  "https://yourserver.com/video3.mkv"
]
--------
[
  {
    "url": "https://yourserver.com/video1.mp4"
  }, 
  {
    "url": "https://yourserver.com/video2.mp4", 
    "start_time": "120.0", 
    "duration": "60.57"
  }
]

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/start_encode2 \
  -d task_token=b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1 \
  -d stitch='[
      {"url" : "https://yourserver.com/video1.mp4"},
      {
       "url" : "https://yourserver.com/video2.mp4", 
       "start_time": "120.0", 
       "duration": "60.57"
      }
    ]’
  -d profiles=5a2a846a26e88

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Stitching videos with /v1/start_encode2

/v1/start_encode2

This route is for stitching videos using /v1/start_encode2 method.

attributes

token

required

b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/start_encode2 \
-d task_token=b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1 \
-d query='{"query": {
  "stitch": [
    {"url" : "https://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode2/stitching/batch3/A4070002.mp4"},
    {"url" : "https://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode2/stitching/batch3/A4070003.mp4", "start_time": "120.0", "duration": "60.57"}
  ],
  "format": [
    {
      "output": "mp4",
      "destination": {
          "url":"s3://s3-eu-west-2.amazonaws.com/qencode-test/stitch/4_clip.mp4",
          "key":"AKIAIKZIPSJ7SDAIWK4A",
          "secret":"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",
          "permissions": "public-read"
       },
      "file_extension": "mp4",
      "size": "640x360",
      "profile": "baseline",
      "level": "41"
      }
    ]

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Getting Transcoding Task Status

/v1/create_token

This route is for inquiring a transcoding task status.

Request example

"format": curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/status -d task_tokens=63adfb01d408081b10440682f3a64114

Request example

curl https://master-79109168ae0711e8b00baa831f35b3f7.qencode.com/v1/status -d task_tokens=d4936f71a242d4b61d790efa217ff9d5

Response example

{"error":0,"statuses":{"d4936f71a242d4b61d790efa217ff9d5":{"status":"downloading","percent":0,"error":0,"error_description":null,"images":[],"videos":[],"status_url":"https:\/\/master-79109168ae0711e8b00baa831f35b3f7.qencode.com\/v1\/status"}}}

Getting Access Token

/v1/create_token

This route is responsible for getting the access token.

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/access_token -d api_key=5a2a846a26ace

Generating Thumbnails

/v1/create_token

This route is responsible for generating thumbnails. There are two ways of thumbnails creation in Qencode API:

  • Generate individual thumbnail by capturing the specific time range on a timeline (specified in % of overall video length)

  • Create a general thumbnail based on the interval value between each thumbnail that is specified in seconds.
    In this case the WebVTT file is being generated seamlessly.

Request example

{
  "output": "thumbnail",
  "time": "0.15",
  "width": "920",
  "height": "500",
  "destination": "",
  "user_tag": "15_920x500"
}

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/start_encode2 \
  -d task_token=b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1 \
  -d query='{"query": {
  "source": "https://qa.qencode.com/static/test_mini.mp4",
  "format": [
       {
              "output": "mp4",
              "destination": {
                "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/test_mini.mp4",
                "key":"abcde12345",
                "secret":"abcde12345",
                "permissions": "public-read"
              },
               "framerate": "29.97",
               "keyframe": "25",
               "file_extension": "mp4",
               "size": "360x240",
               "start_time": "10",
               "duration": "20"
             },
             {
               "output": "thumbnail",
               "time": "0.15",
               "width": "320",
               "height": "240",
               "destination": {
                 "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/thumb/15_320x240.png",
                 "key":"abcde12345",
                 "secret":"abcde12345",
                 "permissions": "public-read"
                },
               "user_tag": "15_320x240"
              },
             {
               "output": "thumbnail",
               "time": "0.50",
               "width": "320",
               "height": "240",
               "destination": {
                 "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/thumb/50_320x240.png",
                 "key":"abcde12345",
                 "secret":"abcde12345",
                 "permissions": "public-read"
                },
               "user_tag": "50_320x240"
              }
            ]
          }
        }

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Interval-based Thumbnails

/v1/create_token

This method is responsible for creating an interval-based thumbnails. The example below demonstrates creation of 320x240 thumbnails at every 30 seconds of a video's timeline. Thumbnails and WebVTT file will be saved into the directory specified in the “url” attribute of “destination” object.

Request example

{
  "output" : "thumbnails",
  "destination": {
    "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/thumb/bbb/",
    "key":"abcde12345",
    "secret":"abcde12345",
    "permissions": "public-read"
  },
  "interval": 30,
  "width" : 320,
  "height" : 240
}

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/start_encode2 \
  -d task_token=b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1 \
  -d query='{"query": {
      "source": "https://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode/bbb_sunflower_1080p_60fps_normal_339mb.mp4",
      "format": [
        {
          "output": "mp4",
          "destination": {
            "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/bbb.mp4",
            "key":"abcde12345",
            "secret":"abcde12345",
            "permissions": "public-read"
          },
          "file_extension": "mp4",
          "size": "320x240",
          "duration": 60
        },
        {
         "output" : "thumbnails",
         "destination": {
            "url":"s3://nyc3.digitaloceanspaces.com/qencode3/test/thumb/bbb/",
            "key":"abcde12345",
            "secret":"abcde12345",
            "permissions": "public-read"
          },
          "interval": 30,
          "width" : 320,
          "height" : 240
        }
      ]
    }
  }

Response example

{"error":0,"upload_url":"https:\/\/storage.qencode.com\/v1\/upload_file","task_token":"471272a512d76c22665db9dcee893409"}

Generating WebVTT for thumbnails

query

There are two ways for generating thumbnail images for videos. WebVTT is a plain text format, part of the HTML5 standard. When used for thumbnails, the VTT files contain links to the actual thumbnail images, which can be in .JPG, .PNG or .GIF format.

attributes

query

required

Source & Format are required

Example of JSON object for query with output format "thumbnails" for creating WebVTT file

 {"query": {
    "source": "https://example.com/your_video.mp4",
    "format": [
      {
        "output": "mp4",
        ...
      },
       {
          "output" : "thumbnails",
          "destination": {
            "url":"s3://s3-eu-west-2.amazonaws.com/bucket/...",
            "key":"your_access_key",
            "secret":"your_access_secret",
            "permissions" : "public-read" //optional field
          },
          "interval": 30, //in seconds
          "width" : 320,
          "height" : 240
        }
    ]
  }
}

Request example

curl https://api.qencode.com/v1/start_encode2 \
  -d task_token=b49e034d198262f1d5d15ed9f3cb8ee1 \
  -d stitch='[
      {"url" : "https://yourserver.com/video1.mp4"},
      {
       "url" : "https://yourserver.com/video2.mp4", 
       "start_time": "120.0", 
       "duration": "60.57"
      }
    ]’
  -d profiles=5a2a846a26e88

Response example

{
  “status_url” : “https://master-ed4971d0bd8811e481e104012ff1f701.qencode.com/v1/status”
}
